snippet: The New York International Fringe Festival, which opened on Friday, relies on a jury of curators to assemble its lineup, which leads some critics to argue that it’s not exactly a “fringe” event.
abstract: New York International Fringe Festival, which has launched its 2013 edition in August, relies on jury of curators to assemble its lineup of shows, leading some critics to argue that it is no longer a fringe event.
lead_paragraph: The New York International Fringe Festival, which opened on Friday, relies on a jury of curators to assemble its lineup, which leads some critics to argue that it’s not exactly a “fringe” event.

headline.main: In a Theater Mecca, ‘Fringe’ Tends to Mean Choosy
headline.print_headline: In a Theater Mecca, ‘Fringe’ Tends to Mean Choosy
